column4: I have two systems connected with a cat-5 crossover cable, and when I try to use vncviewer to connect to the other I get:
Couldn't convert 'joe-desktop' to host address
Unable to connect to VNC server
help?
do they both have ips or did you unplug one from your router, leave it set to DHCP, and expect it to magically suck an IP address through the second computer?
they are both set to dhcp, what would I change it to?
hows the 2nd computer going to get an IP address if its only directly connected to the first?
I didn't think of that, so.. how would I set it up?
you'd give it a static IP
just one?
both might help if they're going to communicat back and forth
so would it be something like
sorry, I'm not sure I understand
Did you set the gateways like I said?
haven't got that far. still testing IPs and such because apparently they matter greatly
hold on I'll try again
uh.. yeah, they're rather important to the tcp/ip stack. You need to set the gateway to be the opposite computers
192.168.2.1 and 192.168.2.2 with the mask set to 255.255.255.0 and the gateway set to 1.2 and 2.1?
gateway set to 2.2 and 2.1.
yes the gateway is the OTHEr computer
ok brb
ok, the computers can ping each other when connected with the crossover cable but when I try to use vnc I get
joe-desktop = an ip address right, and you just changed it to joe-desktop to clean it up or something?
you need to enter the ip, not "joes-desktop" if thats what you're doing
